Summary: Great location, friendly and helpful staff, large rooms with good amenities. Really nicely maintained grounds and a fun resort feel. Special shout out to Leo for always making me feel special and welcome.
Manager Response: Dear Cassie F,  Thank you so much for letting us know about your stay! We greatly appreciate the feedback and kind words, we agree that Leo is fantastic! We hope to see you again the next time you visit Anaheim!  Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Nice room very close to Disneyland
Summary: The room was very clean. The hotel was close to Disneyland so we could come back to the room for a nap.  They let us park before check in and then we walked over to the park.  We will stay here agin for sure!
Manager Response: Dear jenniferaguilar08,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We look forward to being your host again. next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary: I have to give a shout out to Cody for helping me out with parking. Working in the hospitality industry myself, I know the importance of good customer service and I appreciate when I receive it. Thanks again, Cody!
Manager Response: Dear RoAnAc19,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled to hear that "Cody" provided good customer service for you! We hope to see you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: I chose this hotel in the hopes of getting a room with a balcony.  There were none available when I first called but they said there's a chance they'd be available when we arrived.  The patios below are bigger (and have a small landscape feature - tree or plant) but I'd hoped for a view of the fireworks, which was more likely from the balcony.  (Pros for the lower level - big patio, don't have to worry about kids stomping around and bothering downstairs neighbors! If you have a stroller then for sure get ground floor or if you cannot haul your luggage up the steps!  After a hearty discussion about it, DH and I decided the balcony was a good choice for us.)    Layout of property The rooms are all in various buildings with central outdoor walkways.  I didn't see an elevator so I
Manager Response: Dear RiverTraveler,  We greatly appreciate all the feedback you've shared! Unfortunately we don't have any elevators, however we do have ramps on one side and stairs on the other attached to every building so rolling up luggage helps a bit and do provide complimentary bell if needed. We do provide microwaves upon request but don't have them in guest rooms. Our team will go over your feedback to make any necessary changes. We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host and look forward to seeing you again next time you visit the Disneyland Resort!  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary: Great location and staff,  in particular Cody at the parking lot and those at the front desk. The hotel is close to the main entrance of Disneyland ( both within walking distance and via the shuttle) Very nice.
Manager Response: Dear josejavierv68,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We are thrilled to hear kind comments regarding our staff and especially "Cody" as we continue to strive to provide a first class hospitality experience. We hope to see you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary Heading: Good Hotel at a Good Price
Summary: This hotel has a fun retro vibe in the lobby and grounds. The rooms are dated and don't reflect the retro feel of the rest of the hotel. The rooms (double) are large although the bathroom was small and VERY basic - but clean. The pool area is large and nice although the hot tube was quite small. Very friendly and helpful staff!
Manager Response: Dear Peter M,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff. Our sincere apologies if our rooms seem a bit outdated. We will continue to make touch ups to our property in the near future. We hope to see you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disney. Perfect location, no more than a 5 minute walk from the entrance. On the same block you have great food options too, lots of chain restaurants, bubba gumps, Cheesecake Factory along with the likes of macdonalds, Starbucks etc nearby. Lobby area very modern and bright, our room was a little dull, had a motel feel to it but other than that, can’t fault it. In fairness some of the other blocks looked a lot nicer. Pool was superb. Would stay again without hesitation
Manager Response: Dear billybloater,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs to the gates of Disneyland and several restaurants close by. We look forward to being your host again, next time you visit the Anaheim Resort!  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary Heading: Fantastic Pool & Lobby/Horrible Room - Mildew & More
Summary: *** People with Respiratory Problems Should Avoid this Hotel due to the Strong Mildew Smell ***  Pros:  -The staff here are awesome! (big shout out to Leo) -The pool is one of my favorites in all of the Disneyland Resort area. There is tons of room for everyone & the food is made by the awesome restaurant The Pizza Press. -Location is wonderful - You can see Guardians of the Galaxy: Mission Breakout from the Pool Area and it's only an 8 minute walk to Disney (we recommend crossing to the West side of S. Harbor Blvd so you can walk through the nice treed area instead of right beside the busy street.  -The lobby is super fun - The Front Room bar has some delicious drinks too -The grounds are so well manicured and it almost feels like you're in Hawaii. -They have a fun outdoor
Manager Response: Dear honesthotelreview,  We greatly appreciate all the insight you've provided during your stay. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff, especially Leo. Our team takes all feedback serious and will look into several of the issues you've mentioned to make sure it's addressed. We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host during your trip and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary: Great hotel. Close to Disneyland. Double king rooms for families. Love the over sized rooms. =) =) *           * We will stay here again. Check several times rooms open up with cancelation. Clean, nice pool for grandkids.
Manager Response: Dear 625MDH,  Thank you for your feedback. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed the size of our hotel rooms. We look forward seeing you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary: The hotel is located so close to Disneyland and is about a 8 min walk.   Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Rooms were very roomy.  Very nice pool area.  Only complaint was the shower constantly going from hot to cold.  I will definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Steelergrl68,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our friendly staff and hotel accommodations. Our team look into the shower issue.  We look forward to seeing you again, next time you visit the Anaheim Resort!  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary: I tried the Anaheim Hotel because of a recommendation after I had been disappointed with others near Disneyland and all the other attractions. I was greeted by a wonderful reception team and everything was done quickly and orderly. A thin line to cross. The rooms are always sparkling clean and inviting plus I have never been turned down for any request I might have regarding where that room should be located. Oh, and location,  it really is across the street from Disneyland and California Adventure. A quick walk and you're at the many security checks to get into the park. The pool is clean and inviting as well. It's a good place to relax after visiting the park or for a day off. Have fun and Enjoy.
Manager Response: Dear maryadele53,  Thank you for your feedback. We are pleased to hear all the kind comments regarding our staff and hotel. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We hope to catch you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary: This unassuming hotel doesn't look like anything special from the out side, it's well maintained & clean but once you step inside the lobby you know you are some place special. Its decorated in mid century modern, very homey & comfortable. The staff are super helpful & friendly. Once you've checked in you walk out the back of the lobby & you are in your own little happy place. You dont feel like your in a large city, its quiet, the pool is wonderful, the grounds are land scraped, everything is clean. You feel like your in a 60's Vegas film starring Elvis! You will make this place your home away from home.
Manager Response: Dear Beth4233,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled to hear all the wonderful comments regarding The Anaheim Hotel! We hope to see you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary Heading: One great room, one terrible room.
Summary: Selected two upgraded rooms. One with king bed (wood floors, shower door, patio) and one with two queen beds (was also supposed to have upgraded linens, patio/balcony, remodeled). First room was perfect. Nice floors, shower and a wonderful open patio. The second room looked like a motel 6. I purchased both rooms and the second room was for the kids (19 and 20 y/o). Rooms were cheap but that’s not what I paid for. I could have saved $100 by selecting that room from the start. Based on that room I would tell you stay away from this place! Based on the other room I would say perfect hotel within a short walk to Disney. Unfortunately I cannot say that because there is a chance you will get a terrible room. I felt that we should have been refunded the cost of the room or at minimum
Manager Response: Dear Caesarmaxy,  Thank you for your feedback. We are pleased to hear your first room was wonderful. Our sincerest apologies regarding your second room.Truly we are grateful to have been your host and would love another opportunity to make it up to you and your family. Please give us a call at (714-772-5900) and ask for management at your earliest convenience. Our team hopes to hear from you soon.   Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary: My family stayed here when they came to visit from Chicago to be close to Disneyland. My five star rating is all for LEO who provided excellent valet service. He's extremely personable, professional, and is constantly seeking ways to assist the guest in any way he can in order to make their stay the best it can be. Fantastic, refreshing sense of humour that can turn anyone's day around. Unfortunately I am unable to give an very detailed review regarding the property but if the rest of the service at the hotel is anything like the service that LEO provides, then it deserves the five star rating! THANK YOU LEO!!
Manager Response: Dear MDW2LAX,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding "Leo". He truly is a treasure to have apart of our staff. We hope to see you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary: Heat the jacuzzi, barely warm.  Wanted a hot jacuzzi after a long day at Disneyland. Location is great, easy walk from the park. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was nice, especially the server/bartender that served us food.  Helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Catherine B,  Thank you for your feedback. Our sincere apologies if the Jacuzzi wasn't as hot as you preferred, we will have our engineering team look into this issue. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding the cleanliness of the room and our staff. We hope to see you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary Heading: I killed a roach in my room!!!
Summary: It’s a short 10 minute walk from Disneyland and at first impression, this place is adorable. The lobby reminds me of the style from the show “Bewitched”.  There’s a cute bar and Pizza Press on-site. There are seven separate buildings on the property that contain the actual hotel rooms. I stayed in the 600 block, which was behind the pool. Speaking of the pool, it’s huge! I didn’t get in it, but it’s a lap pool with plenty of lounge chairs all around. Now, back to the room. These rooms are not in an enclosed building, and there are two floors. Here’s where my one star rating starts. We swiped our card to enter and couldn’t get the door open. It was stuck like the door had been recently painted and was tacky. After a hard shove, I got it open. I was disappointed to see that the
Manager Response: Dear Solsbabe,  Thank you for your feedback. We sincerely apologize that you had less than an enjoyable experience. I can assure you that we get our property serviced routinely by a third party to avoid any pesticides. Certainly, we take this very seriously and will follow up with our team to look into this matter to assure you it is addressed. Our team will look into the other issues you have mentioned to make the necessary adjustments to continue to provide a first class hospitality experience. We would love another opportunity to make it up to you, please contact the hotel directly at your earliest convenience. Again, we apologize and hope to hear from you soon.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores

Summary Heading: Not Quite as Magical as It Could Be
Summary: I researched most good neighbor hotels months before our visit and found The Anaheim to be the best around. It delivered a lot during our four days, but it took back some as well. Let me quickly lay it all out.  Pros - Location is one block from main gate. Two depending on where your room is. See map for help on that. - Great pool with Rat Pack music and lots of palm trees to get you in the mood. - Friendly concierge and helpful staff - Nicely sized rooms - Convenient parking - Good pizza place off the lobby  Cons - 10 minute wait for hot water in the shower. We had to let it run and wait. - Well worn rooms with dirty dated furniture and motel style outside hallways - Cleaning staff can take until 4:30 to refresh your room.  - $15 parking with tax comes to $17.55 a day. Just a
Manager Response: Dear sloomis31,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity to the gates of Disneyland fit your travel needs. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed our pool and The Pizza Press. Our sincere apologies regarding the hot water and lost stuffed animal. We will have our engineering and housekeeping team look into these issues to assure you they are addressed and followed up in a professional manner. We hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: An easy walk to the Magic.
Summary: This hotel was close to the entrance of Disney as well as clean with great beds  - that's all this family can ask for!  We would certainly consider another stay here.  A great value, location and hotel!!
Manager Response: Dear benhardt22,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We look forward to seeing you next time you visit the Anaheim Resort!  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We have stayed a several hotels both on property as well as nearby Disneyland Resort. We found Anaheim Hotel to have the following- Friendly staff, a fantastic pool, quiet rooms, reasonable walking distance from the parks. Room had a decent fridge. Attached restaurant was pretty good. Hotel happy hour and communal eating space is nice.  The in-room shower is pretty terrible, controls feel close to breaking, water pressure is very low. Furnishings in the room are pretty battered. Old, dings, chips. Tubs/sinks/toilets are economy level and really show wear and tear. It’s all cosmetic stuff and didn’t really bother us, but it’s relevant to some travelers. The housekeeping staff kept our beds fresh and our room in the back, close to the rear of the property was delightfully quiet.
Manager Response: Dear travelersplustoddler,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff. We deeply apologize about any issues you may have had throughout your stay. Our team will go over your feedback to ensure these issues are looked into and addressed in a timely manner. Again, we apologize and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Overall good experience. Staff very professional and welcoming. Clean and newly renovated. Room was small, but outdoor patio space for ground level. Only spent 2 nights with a late check in so not much time to explore and take advantage of all they had to offer. Pizza restaurant was good and prices were decent.
Manager Response: Dear Jamie L,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled to hear our staff was professional and welcoming as we strive to provide a first class hospitality experience. Great to hear you enjoyed The Pizza Press connected to the hotel. We hope to see you in the future, next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Great location for our first "good neighbor" use near Disneyland...we have typically used the Disneyland Towers or Grand Californian. Yes, the hotel is "dated" in its theme, but that's a great part of its charm...and, in some aspects...very stylish, although with a vibe of blues/swing from my folks youth (late 50s, early 60s). Main lobby accommodations are nicely improved (per the hotel's website)...the place shines...our room needs "next upgrade" touches...little things like "popcorn" ceiling removed and the designers "theme" carried through with just a little more work to finalize. Else, the feel, accommodations and "class" of the place is very well composed. AND family friendly. Kudos to the lobby staff for fast assistance at all aspects of the check-in and room availability.
Manager Response: Dear Keithw34,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding The Anaheim Hotel. We have finished major renovations these past couple years and continue to make some touch ups around the property every so often. We hope to see you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We spent two days in Disneyland and this hotel has the best location by far. It is across the street - easily a 10-minute walk to the park entrances (and downtown Disney). The AC unit worked well, and we had a nice balcony in our room. I believe there are handicapped ramps in some of the buildings, but I'm not sure about elevators (we carried our luggage up the one flight of stairs to our room). The pool was nice and kept clean each day, as well. Our only complaint is that the water pressure in the shower was a bit weak, but we would still stay here again simply due to the location. It is also a 10-minute drive from the Angels stadium, and about a 30-minute drive to Long Beach. There is a parking lot, but we did not use a car so I'm not sure how much it is per night.
Manager Response: Dear Mquintano,  Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! We are extremely pleased that your party enjoyed our location and amenities! I do apologize for the challenge with the water pressure, we will have this addressed immediately. Once again, thank you for your kind words and we hope to see you again in the future!  Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: This hotel exceeded my expectations . Clean, friendly service and amazing location  Once you enter this hotel you find a secret oasis. The pool is beautiful and clean and the grounds and courtyard were great places to sit and enjoy some peace and quiet surrounded by palm trees..
Manager Response: Dear Claudia L,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled to hear such kind comments about exceeding your expectations regarding your stay with our hotel and staff! We hope to see you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: It’s an awesome bedding  very well maintained rooms . Very fast check-in never a wait. The lounge area is awesome the bar offers an amazing happy hour very affordable. Bartender is so sweet always smiling and her service was excellent.
Manager Response: Dear Mestela12,  Thank you for your feedback. It's great to hear such kind comments regarding your stay at The Anaheim Hotel. We hope to see you in the future, next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: The room was very dark and stank of marijuana. A complaint to the hotel garnered an indifferent shrug. The curious bathroom arrangement and old shower curtain were something of a throwback. The bed was very uncomfortable. The kitchen was closed when we arrived and shut when we got up. Pool was nice. Location was handy for Disneyland. Overall the place was unwelcoming and disappointing. So glad we only stayed for a weekend. Would never go back.
Manager Response: Dear bpr2015,  Thank you for your feedback. We deeply apologize about the issues that occurred throughout your stay. We will address this issue with our team so that it may be resolved as we continue to strive to provide a first class hospitality experience. We would love for you to reach out to us at the hotel so that we can do our very best to make it up to you in the future.   Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay with family
Summary: Really nice place; newly remodeled.  The pool is huge (olympic size).  Walking distance to Disneyland.  Cute little pizza place attached to hotel that is reasonable and has good food.  The bellman, Leo was a big help.  He answered all of our questions and gave helpful suggestions.  He was fun to chat with too.
Manager Response: Dear gsdobrien,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff! Great to hear "Leo" was a big help and assisted you with any questions you may have had. We hope to see you again.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Staff

Summary: Stayed at the Anaheim Hotel from 7/19 to 7/22.  Love the location, swear it I should closer to park entrances than Disneyland Hotel (which I love).  Lobby ambiance is great (my childhood) and the rooms are large and well apportioned.  Only complaint is the shower head is lower than I like.  Anytime I am thinking budget and Disneyland together, this is where I am staying.
Manager Response: Dear ghlewicki56,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel. Our team will look into the the shower issue. We hope to see you again.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Staff

Summary: We chose this hotel because it was a Disney Neighborhood hotel with close proximity to the park and participating in the Disney vacation packages.  I knew it was not a new or modern hotel but had a facelift.   Our room was apparently an executive king but was not ideal for a 5 day stay with a teenager. There were only 3 small draws for clothes (we did get some extra hangers provided to us for the cupboard), 2 chairs and a tiny desk. There was no real space to sit and eat or anything like that, we ate our room meals on the bed. Our room did not have a balcony or courtyard although a lot of rooms did so there was no where to sit outside or any room to dry wet clothes from rides or the pool.  The bathroom vanity area was very large with a double basin but the small shower was over
Manager Response: none

Summary: Awesome place to stay. Staff is so friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and very roomy. Loved the balcony, watched fireworks every night. Pool area was not crowded with its olympic sized pool. Would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our favorite hotel to stay in when we visit Disneyland. Rooms are clean and comfortable, and the beds are nice. Linens are clean and fresh. Rooms have balconies or patios with bistro tables. When you’re spending all day at Disney, which is an easy walk across the street, you don’t need bells and whistles in the room. Parking is easy, and it’s close to Target and other restaurants and stores. They have a great pool and lovely people working at the front desk. Mid century theme is fun and attractive.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a good visit - all staff were super-helpful - rooms were clean and functional - pool was awesome - close to / walking distance from DisneyLand and the Anaheim Convention Center - lots to do around this hotel
Manager Response: Dear Voyage45459436361,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff! Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We hope to see you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: We loved the renovations and the pool is very large and has an outdoor bar. It’s a close walking distance to the parks as well. We will definitely be booking there again on our upcoming trips. Pizza Port is there now too!
Manager Response: Dear rmccusker2019,  Thank you for your feedback, We are thrilled to hear you enjoy our renovations that we have completed so far. Its always a pleasure to hear our hotels close proximity to the gates of Disneyland fits our guest travel needs. We look forward to seeing you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: The Anaheim Hotel is a great option if you're going in a small group to Disneyland. It's literally across the street from Guardians of Galaxy. Everything was very nice, if some was a little dated. But they are playing up the fact that they are an original Mid Century hotel. We thought the vintage fixtures were neat and added to the character of the hotel.  We had a 'Park View Room' which gave us a nice balcony that overlooked the grounds of the hotel. It was a wonderful change from other budget hotels in the area where you end up looking over a parking lot. The room itself was good sized with a proper closet. The only amenity it was lacking for us was a microwave.  The hotel itself has extra amenities others don't, such as on-site laundry, swimming pool and jacuzzi, business
Manager Response: Dear SaturnnFoxx,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate the kind comments regarding our hotel. Its great to hear you enjoyed our Disney view rooms overlooking the fireworks, We do have microwaves available upon request at no additional charge. Truly we are grateful you allowed us to be your host and hope you consider us again next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Very nice room for an affordable price
Summary: Excellent rooms for much cheaper than the competitors in the same area. Friendly staff. There is a parking fee but it is across from Disneyland so understandable. The rooms were clean and the pool was huge and well maintained.
Manager Response: Dear psyex2,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff! We hope to see you next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, Robert Flores Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Enjoyed our 7 nights stay at the Anaheim hotel. Whilst check-in was 4.00 pm, we were able to check-in when we arrived at 9.00 am. The rooms were clean and had adequate amenities including an ironing board, iron, safe, hairdryer, fridge, international power adaptor, USB charging station, large flat screen TV and a desk. The only missing appliance was a kettle.  Staff are very friendly and helpful. It is less than 10 minutes walk to the gates of Disneyland. From the 50 meter swimming pool you can watch the fireworks every night. There is small gym on site as well as a self service laundry.  There is a bar and pizza restaurant in the hotel but there are many food outlets and restaurants that are within walking distance from the hotel including Penara, Macdonald's, Cheese Cake
Manager Response: Dear Ken S,  Thank yo for taking the time to provide us feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff. Its always great to hear our hotels close proximity fit our guest travel needs. We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: The site i booked from did not display the room i received. I was expecting a much more modern room. I blame my self as well as i should have did my research on the hotel, I did not care for the fact parking was only discounted for those staying at the hotel. Our parking fee was $15. I also payed a small resort fee of i believe $5 a night even though my room did not get cleaned on my 2 nights stay. The only thing i liked about this hotel was the distance fro the park and the pool.
Manager Response: Dear Tiffany B,  Thank you for your feedback. We deeply apologize about the issues that may have occurred during your stay. Rest assured this isn't a consistent issue. We will address this issue with our housekeeping team so that it may be resolved as we continue to strive to provide a first class hospitality experience. Please feel free to reach out to us at the hotel so that we can try our very best to make it up to you.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary Heading: *** HOTEL ROOM BROKEN INTO AND CAR STOLEN
Summary: *** HOTEL BROKEN INTO AND CAR STOLEN*** With a great location across from Disney it was anything near the happiest place on earth. Woke up to find our wallets, vehicle keys and jewelry missing. All taken while we slept and with no concern from any management. As the employees were notified of this horrific act they showed no concern and provided no assistance. They advised us that they had no surveillance cameras and unsure where their security was during the incident. The employees ignored what had happened and couldn't even assist with calling the police. I would recommend staying anywhere else with better security and make sure you find a place where at the very least the employees would show some sort of sympathy. When a supervisor was called and once again advised of this
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff will go out of their way anytime you need anything at this hotel best hotel in California as far as we are concerned!!! Concierge Candy is the best at what she does! Leo the bellhop manager is also just as amazing!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been taking my family to this hotel for the last 2 years or more. I have always been able to watch for good deals and change my room fees as needed. Love the pool and hot tub. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Will be back in Sey. For like our 20th visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay here was perfect thanks to Leo from front of the house.  He made sure our accomodations were suited to our taste and helped us to move rooms immediately.  He was respectful and considerate of our needs.  Thank you, Leo.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Anaheim Hotel is a Disney partner and right across the street from Disneyland.  The lobby has been fully renovated and there is a bar/restaurant within.  The pool is also nice and there is a grassy area for pets!  The rooms are clean, but dated.  Our bathroom needed new grout about 5 years ago.  Our shower handle was broken, but the staff fixed it quickly.  I would stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I wish I could write a good review about this place because we have stayed here a few times. Unfortunately our last stay will likely be our last. We stayed in mid June for 3 nights while we went to Disneyland with our kids. In the last night at 3:45am my wife went to use the restroom and found a giant roach in the bathroom area (see pictures) she woke me to deal with it which I did. My wife did not sleep the rest of the night for fear there were more in the room. She was extremely worried they had gotten into our luggage and food which is a real concern. In they morning I went to the front desk with the dead roach in bag and explained what happened. I was told a manager would not be in until 10am which was after we were checking out. When we did check out I saw they had given us
Manager Response: Mr. Jones,  On behalf of The Anaheim Hotel, I would like to sincerely apologize for the concerns you have expressed above. I can assure you we take all pest issues very seriously and am sorry you did not receive that treatment during your stay! We have coordinated with our Professional Pest Control company to take immediate action to treat and inspect the remainder of the property. I have left a voicemail message in hopes to discuss this incident further and hope we can make it up to you!   In Hospitality,  Austin Russell Front Office Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel kind of last minute, and we surprisingly got a big room for our amily of 4. It was an 8-10 minute walk to Disneyland. Which  was awesome because of all the walking we did at the parks. There is also a pizzeria at the hotel which is great for a midnight  snack or lunch or dinner. If you dont want to eat there, there's  plenty of other restaurants around
Manager Response: Dear Global07446167523,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! The Pizza Press is a great option for meals, I agree! We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: A relaxing friendly place to stay
Summary: The staff was very friendly and professional. The room was clean and well made up. Our stay was beyond relaxing. The pool was a great place to cool down and relax in the afternoon. The Anaheim Hotel is so conveniently located with walking distance of the park entrance and a number of good restaurants. I always stay at the Anaheim Hotel when I'm visiting because theyes provide great value and an enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: Dear Pioneer46777546663,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel!  We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we look forward to seeing you again for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: This is a súrtanles location, almost in front of the acces to Disney parks and next to restaurants. The pizza is delicious. The Room is Just for sleep and take a shower. The fridge is very small and the security box never worked. The service was very good
Manager Response: Dear malonsomerlos,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! I apologize for the challenge you encountered with the safe, our team has addressed this now. We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed our location and service and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: Fun retro decor, super friendly staff, and close to Disneyland - from our room to security at the park was 10 minutes.  Loved the pool and the poolside service. Room was a little small but we were only there to sleep and shower.
Manager Response: Dear Chrissy R,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs to the gate of Disneyland.   Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: There are numerous hotels within walking distance of Disneyland, but my husband and I settled on the Anaheim Hotel after finding a good deal on Priceline. We feel like we lucked out with this find!   The entire staff was great. The staff member who checked us in was extremely friendly and helpful, even though we were checking in late at night. I’m sorry I can’t remember his name! We also noticed staff members facilitating activities for kids during the day.  Our room was spacious and clean. Our only issue was the shower. Water pressure was poor and the temperature alternated between scalding and cold.  The lobby is spacious and features a bar that is open late. My husband bought a breakfast sandwich from the attached pizza restaurant one morning, but did not find it to be a
Manager Response: Dear Margarettravels1,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We greatly appreciate the kind comments regarding our hotel staff as we strive to provide a first class hospitality experience. We will share your feedback with our team to make the necessary changes to continue to improve The Anaheim Hotel.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: Just arrived home tonight after staying 3 nights.  Pros:  Great location  Looks nice and modern (until you get to your room)  Friendly staff Nice happy hour options everyday 3-6pm and 9-11pm  Hotel restaurant has pizza available until 1am Nice pool area Cons:  The room could have been cleaner.. like way cleaner!  If you are still in your room when your house keeper comes to service your room. They leave a note saying that your room won’t be cleaned that day and to contact guest services for any items needed.  With all that said, I might would give them another try if they can tackle the cleanliness issue.
Manager Response: Dear G8790NQheaterb,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled to hear all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff. We will look into the cleanliness issues you have mentioned to ensure our guest satisfaction and needs. Truly we are grateful you allowed us to be your host and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: If you don’t mind bringing along your own clean towels, cups, soap and a vacuum then this is the place for you. We stayed 5 nights and only received maid service one day, and that was because I requested it on my way past the front desk while leaving one morning. Never at any time did we ask to not have the maids come in. The most puzzling part was that one night we arrived at 11:00pm only to find that the maids had come in, untucked all of the sheets on the beds and then left them that way. They did not do one other thing. We literally had to clean up the maids mess before we could go to bed that night. When I reported this to the front desk staff they were certainly very apologetic, but their apologies did not get our room cleaned. The hotel is otherwise quite charming, but no
Manager Response: Dear Nancy,  On behalf of The Anaheim Hotel, I would like to sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you have described. I can assure you that is not our standard when servicing rooms and I would like to discuss this with you further. If you could please contact the hotel directly at your earliest convenience, I would love to make this right. I am very sorry to hear about the troubles and hope to hear from you soon! (714) 772-5900  In Hospitality,   Austin Russell  Front Office Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights. Staff are nice. Rooms are great, our ground floor room had a private patio area, beds comfy, lots of space. Heated pool was great on colder days, lovely hot tub. Its a a few hundred meters down the rd to the entrance to Disneyland parks and downtown Disney, i couldn't believe how close it was, you can walk there in under 5 mins. There are lots of cheap restraunts nearby but the pizza place at the hotel is good and price is even better. Plus cocktail hour between 9-11 pm in hotel bar. Lots of drinks and food only $5. We stayed an extra couple of days as it was such a nice hotel, and drove to all the other places we wanted to visit in LA as we couldn't get such a nice hotel for that price anywhere else.
Manager Response: Dear Explore44813312523,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel!  We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: Can't beat the distance to Disneyland. everything within walking distance.  Safe area, didn't see any problems. The rooms were very clean and quiet.  Parking fee was reasonable for each night.  Staff was very helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Adventure56928856123,  We greatly appreciate the feedback about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel!  We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: I loved my experience at The Anaheim Hotel! The beautiful design, landscape and rooms made me feel so warm and welcome. It really did feel like I was coming home at the end of a long Disneyland Day. Not to mention it's right across the street! And the beds were so incredibly comfy! There are not enough sweet things to say about their incredible staff. They go above and beyond with friendly service and kind conversation. (Hi Candi!) I felt like I was leaving friends behind on my last day. I can't recommend this hotel enough,and I cannot wait to go back! Thank you Anaheim Hotel.
Manager Response: Dear BeaMegs,  Thank you so much for your kind words about our property and staff! We agree that Candi is wonderful!  We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we look forward to seeing you again for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: Great value. Perfect place for the whole family !  look no further. The grounds are kept very clean. The rooms are excellent. From the smallest rooms to the largest rooms. Very family friendly. Staff is courteous and kind !
Manager Response: none

Summary: If your looking for easy access to the Disneyland and California Adventure in a family friendly environment moderately price this is work a look. The staff were excellent.  The Pizza Press has excellent pizza.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect digs for a Disney Vacation
Summary: We have stayed at The Anaheim Hotel a couple of times as we are AP holders from the Bay Area.  We like something close to the parks that offers a pool for those hot afternoons, but can't afford to pay thousands of dollars every couple months for a trip. The staff is friendly and helpful (FedExed my wallet home I left in the safe), the pool is huge, the beds are comfortable, and it is so close the Disney parks!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great location close to Disneyland. Their staff is friendly and the rooms and grounds are maintained with attention to detail. Food options on site provide a convenient and tasty alternative to eating in the Disney parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great property.. beautiful landscapes after a long day at Disneyland.. our room was on the second floor and we had a view of the pool again very peaceful.  Kids love the huge pool very clean and good music.  The gift shop on the property is fun to take a look at all their stuff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Leo, the doorman kicked off our great stay! We arrived at 10am and were hoping to get an early check in, say around 3. Leo walked me to the front desk and encouraged me to check in early. To my surprise the room was ready! Never in my life have I been able to check in anywhere 6hrs early. That made an early morning of travel so much easier with our kids. We were able to get settled, park and head to Disney. The entire time every staff member was very accommodating and helpful. The rooms were basic but had a nice little patio and were clean. I would easily book at this hotel again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean hotel and grounds.  Very friendly staff.  Had the great pleasure of meeting Leo who helped out a bunch.  Thank you Leo for all you do at the Anaheim Hotel.  They are lucky to have someone like you!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: So yes this hotel is walking distance to DISNEYLAND. Great! NO. We booked a 3 night weekend for our family, 2 adults 2 kids. According to pictures the hotel looks clean and well kept and for the price it must be. Nope, we were horribly disappointed. Our room smelled like MOLD, It was nothing like the pictures it was old and dirty: carpets dirty and vacuumed, floors unswept. Dirty linen(blankets/towels gross stains or wet and moldy smelling). Areas of the walls and baseboards and tile were broken and cracked. The worst was the bathroom, the bathtub paint was peeling and the door did not work(if you closed the door while toileting it could only be opened from the exterior). Hands Down WORST experience thanks to slow and arrogant customer service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Anabella Hotel redirected us to this place, and it was somewhat disappointing, Cheap but bad. very close to disney two minutes walk if it is what you are looking for ..In truth is that web sites sometimes have a trick and make you book through fictitious offers and images, but the best proof is when you live them ...
Manager Response: Dear LeonardSolis L, Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! I sincerely apologize for the challenges you encountered during your visit with us. We greatly appreciate your feedback, we will investigate your concerns with fictitious offers and images appearing on websites. We are grateful you allowed us to be your host during your trip and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort. Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Great hotel option Close to Disneyland
Summary: We have been trying different hotels when we goto disney;and and we think we finally found "the one".  Large, clean rooms with a comfy bed and pillows. Across the street from Disneyland, just an easy walk. Try this out you won't be disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Friar79,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel!  We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and grateful to be considered "the one"! We look forward to seeing you again for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: This hotel is certainly showing it’s age and lack of upgrades in guest rooms, the lobby and bar area have been upgraded. Some concerns are no elevator to the second story, only accessible by non ada compliant switchback ramps. No grab bars in the shower/tub, no friction tape or bath mats either and the tub floor is very slippery. There was visible mold on the bathroom tiles and baseboard in our room (nothing Tilex can’t fix). The ice machine in our wing (100 Wing) was not working. The positives: staff is outstanding, professional and very polite...great people! The attached pizza joint has great pizzas and offers a very good breakfast. It’s a block from the main entrance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear 168michaelf168,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! I sincerely apologize for the challenges you encountered during your visit with us. While we do have some select rooms which offer additional ADA accessibility, we greatly appreciate your feedback and will have these concerns regarding accessibility brought forward for attention. We are extremely grateful for the kind words about our staff and we hope you consider us again for your next trip!  Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, with friendly staff!
Summary: We stayed in a 2 King Room for 8 nights, in room 426 in building 400, one of the farthest rooms from the lobby. We only have 3 negatives, yet they would not prevent us from staying again or telling friends it’s a great spot.  1-  the WiFi was terrible  2- we didn’t like the pillows  3- noisy A/C ( bring ear plugs  The location and the staff are what make this place a great place to stay. There is a nice pool, exercise room, the grounds are well kept. Restaurant and bar as well, you can get food and drinks brought pool side. We will make this our go to place.
Manager Response: Dear VictoriaLaxman,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! I sincerely apologize for the challenges you encountered during your visit with us. We greatly appreciate your feedback and will have these concerns regarding the WiFi and AC addressed. We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Nice place and convenient to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is very clean and includes a pool, a bar and restaurant as well as some wonderful seating areas around the property! There are also many restaurants that are walking distance from the hotel like “Denny’s” IHOP and “Tony Roma’s Place for Ribs” We love the fact that it’s only three walking blocks from the main entrance to Disneyland & California Adventure parks.   Located in the heart of Anaheim the area feels safe, the staff is very friendly and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. We were grateful to have a mini fridge in our room as well as a coffee pot. As for the rooms, it’s not a 5 star hotel but the accommodations are very adequate! There is a parking fee but they didn’t charge us for the day we checked out and left our vehicle in their lot while spending the
Manager Response: Dear laurisgotmusic,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! We greatly appreciate all of the kind words. We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: good overall hotel, within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this hotel after being unable to get reservations on Disney property. We were quite happy with the stay. It is an older building, but they have kept it in good repair. (Note: You will have no problem with this is you are from southern California like I am, but be aware that many buildings/homes - like this hotel- have the hot and cold water reversed. Turn the faucet right to get hotter water and left to get colder water.) The most wear and tear showed in the rooms, such as older tile in the bathroom area. The room came with a small fridge and coffee maker, but no microwave (in our room, which was in the lowest price range). Free Wi-Fi. The lobby is decorated in 50's retro style. There is a gift shop, a small fitness center, a laundry. Also a fairly large pool area.
Manager Response: Dear Janice8204,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! While not all of our rooms include microwaves by default, our staff should be more than happy to have one delivered to your room complimentary upon request. We agree that the Pizza Press offers fantastic meals for breakfast or anytime after! We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: For what we paid for this hotel, it is exactly what we expected! Upon arriving, the grounds are beautiful and the lobby is pretty! We arrived a little early and they didn’t have a room ready yet but they upgraded our room. The rooms are definitely old but clean. We could tell the carpets had been cleaned and still drying when we entered our room. The water temperature is all over the place so if you have children be careful because it can go from scalding to cold. The hotel is a really easy walk to the park and the Pizza Press restaurant is convenient (and really good) after a long day at the park!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My stay at the Anaheim Hotel
Summary: Overall, excellent hotel. Room was not made up on one day. It took them 1hour to bring the items to our room. The attendant out front was great. He even said that if he was off of work, he would take me to Buena Park to pick up my truck. He always had a smile for you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We love this hotel! Stayed here twice for Disneyland trips and will stay here again. The rooms are very clean and new. The Pizza Press restaurant and Front Room bar located in the lobby have high quality food and great craft beer selection. After a long day at Disneyland it’s nice to just unload everything in the room and simply walk to the lobby for a beer and some pizza, no driving! Highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: One of the best properties I have stayed at around Disneyland.. Been there 3 times and booking again in May. Rooms are clean and well maintained Patios are AWESOME and the property is gorgeous  Super short walk to Disneyland  Everyone was so nice and friendly
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 3 nights on our Spring Break trip.  Great location within a 5 minute walk to Disneyland.  Onsite bar and restaurant were good and convenient.  Much better deal than staying on property or at other nearby hotels.  Only had 1 issue and that was with the housekeeping.  We left early every morning to go to the parks and were normally back around 1PM for a break.  We came back both mornings and our room was not cleaned yet.  Not a big deal as I understand the schedule we were on was a little weird, but when I asked them on the second afternoon if they could clean it that night while we were gone, they said they would and no one did.  So our room was not cleaned once while we were there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location is 5 minutes walking distance from Disneyland.  The staff is helpful & friendly. (Thank you Leo!)  The water pressure in this hotel was amazing!!  As was the Pizza Press and bar/lounge.  My visit was in April 2019 and I'm already planning my next stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is reasonably priced for the average family and has everything you need- close to Disneyland, great pool, convenience store, restaurant (pizza) and best of all, fabulous caring staff.  They went out of their way to help with airport shuttle service and get our rooms together.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The facilities yard is beautiful with green lawns and flowers.  The rooms are clean and large; however, the shower area show some deterioration (water damage).  Great value overall. Two block walk from Disney, one block walk from CVS, Walgreens, and Starbucks and next door to Denny's for those who are on a budget.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I drove in from Phx to surprise my 7 and 16-year-old with a weekend trip to Disney.  The hotel staff was very friendly but Leo took takes the cake❣️❣️ he was not only professional he was also friendly and fantastic. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious. We even had a private fenced in patio. Everything was almost perfect, however the Ac didn’t cool the room as expected. Even with the ac issues, for the limited time we were in there we were very comfortable. We also spent time in the pool and hot tub. A true life saver after walking 12 hours!! All in all we had a GREAT stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was overall disappointed with our stay at this hotel. Yes, for sure it is a close walk to Disneyland, but the overall experience makes me want to advise others not to stay here.  1st of all, the water pressure and hot water in the showers are a major issue. When you read other reviews further down like we did, this had come up a couple of times but the hotel had responded that they were working on fixing this problem. I would still say this is not fixed and we had cold or Luke warm showers our entire stay.   2nd, the wifi internet is not only unreliable, it’s basically non existent. We never had a time where our phone or computers connected to the wifi for more than 10 min, if that. And when it was connected, it was unable to stream any type of media in any timeframe.   3rd,
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Anaheim Hotel was conveniently located and well-priced given the area. The rooms were clean and the staff were overall friendly. The AC worked well, and the beds were comfy with spacious rooms. However, the shower water pressure did leave something to be desired. Also, while there was usually adequate warm water, there were instances of us being required to take lukewarm showers. Overall, the fair price with close proximity to Disneyland makes it worth consideration.   I do feel obliged to say that I did have concerns regarding the safety of our belongings in our room. I do realize that I am not able to definitively prove it, but myself and my partner were absolutely 100% certain of returning to the room with my $200 sunglasses on one of the days, and leaving them in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: On the positive side, the location is good, only a 10 minute walk to the park entrances and 5 minutes to Walgreens to stock up on some groceries. The hotel foyer has a lovely mid-century vibe and the bar is great. It was February, so we didn't get to use the pool or jacuzzi, however they and the hotel grounds look great too. Leo's welcome as we arrived was great as were the bar staff. However, the negatives outweighed the positives, and as a travel consultant, are the reasons why I won't be booking my clients to stay there. The first 2 rooms they allocated to us set off my asthma within minutes. The first room was mouldy, probably due to the heavy rain they had at the time, and the second had a very strong chemical smell, like the room had been recently fumigated. They did
Manager Response: Dear ellenwillow,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity to the gates of Disneyland and Walgreens fit your travel needs. We truly appreciate the kind comments regarding our staff. We deeply apologize about any issues you may have had and assure you these issue aren't common. We will share your feedback with our team to ensure you these issues are addressed in a timely manner. We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: Stayed here three nights while visiting Disneyland for birthday celebrations. There were four of us and we had a room with two king beds. Beds were comfortable and room was fresh and clean. Bathroom had separate sinks from commode and shower which made it easy to get ready in the mornings.  Vary large pool with large separate hot tub.  Unfortunately children used the hot tube to play in with blow up toys and lots of grass an leaves in it from the kids running around In and out.  My wife is handicap and we did not have to pay for parking.  They have a nice bar with beer and cocktails and a very large gifts and snack shops.  You can buy they same Disneyland gifts here for about 30% less than in the park.  It’s very close to the parks and is a short 10 minute walk to the parks.
Manager Response: Dear Salidaboy209,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled you chose The Anaheim Hotel to have a birthday celebration. Great to hear you enjoyed all our amenities we have to offer along with our hotels close proximity fitting your travel needs. We hope to see you next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: The location is very convenient; it’s walking distance to Disneyland.  Rooms are comfortable and we especially were thankful for the large bathroom with 2 sinks.  Great lobby area with fun retro vibe. Our favorite place to stay when going to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Dear Seaside63902803873,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay, we look forward to seeing you next time you visit the Disney Resort again!  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary Heading: Perfect place for family trip to Disneyland - Great pool, great location, great price!
Summary: We loved staying at this hotel - it had everything we needed at a very economical price.  The furniture in the rooms / bathrooms are a bit dated, but clean and comfortable beds, a big TV (with an easy to understand remote), USB ports everywhere to charge electronics, a balcony to retreat to.  The lobby is is a stylish mid-century modern place to hang out, with a great lounge.  We went to the attached Pizza Press several times, super tasty.  A fantastic, huge pool, with an 11-foot deep end that we loved taking a break from the park and swimming in (so large that never seemed crowded.)  And less than a 10-minute walk from the entrance - best of all. But so many things were good it is hard to pick the best feature.  We will definitely be staying here when we visit again.
Manager Response: Dear Nansgar,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay at The Anaheim Hotel! We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host during your trip and look forward to seeing you again, next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Food, Great Staff, Great Place to vacation!
Summary: Our room was amazing, clean, great service! The bar with a happy hour, and the Pizza Press located in the lobby made it great for food or snacks without having to leave. Super great location to Disney and you're able to enjoy the fireworks from the hotel!  Candi, their concierge, was amazing!!! We had wonderful cookies and water in our room, she was able to tell us all the great places to do locally and even had the ability to set us up for Hollywood Tours!!!!  Would absolutely stay here again, had a wonderful experience!
Manager Response: Dear Tricia B,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff, especially "Candi" as she is truly a treasure to have with our team. We look forward to seeing you next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: Our family has traveled to Disneyland and we always stay in the good neighbor hotels. We happened upon this one and were very happy with our stay. Ease of access to the parks and a private balcony with a perfect view of the fireworks made it so worth it! We will be back!!!
Manager Response: Dear 632aranr,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed our hotels close proximity to the Disney Parks. We look forward to seeing you next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: The Anaheim Hotel is a great location and great value for your money. You don't have to go to Disneyland to meet friendly folks.  Leo, Joseph and Sabrina make you feel right at home.  Thank you!   Rooms are clean, a bit dated on the furniture, but not a problem.  We are their to sleep and enjoy the days at Disneyland.   Great hotel vibe and fun bar!
Manager Response: Dear Cindy M,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear you enjoyed our hotels close proximity. Leo, Joseph & Sabrina are truly a treasure to have with us on our team! We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host and hope to see you again, next time you visit the Disneyland Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: Stayed here for 4 days while visiting Disneyland.  The staff was great.  They were very informative and took the time to talk to you.  They have a very organized bag hold system if you get in early or are leaving late but want another day in the park.  It is a very walkable distance to main gates.  The room was clean when we got there and each day was cleaned well.  The king room we had was large and felt very spacious.  I will say that there is no elevator to second floor rooms with. Exterior hall ways but they have, I think 6 building, so they are set up so pepole have to go through main lobby to get there. I will stay here again if I go back.
Manager Response: Dear covalentblond,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our staff and we are thrilled to hear they were very informative with any questions you may have had. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We look forward to seeing you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary Heading: RUN DOWN, INSECTS, DON'T STAY HERE
Summary: Don't stay here! Reeked of mildew. The bathtub was painted white to hide rust or stains. The internet didn't work even though they tried to fix it. The chest of drawers was damaged so drawers wouldn't open/close. The air conditioning sounded like an airplane taking off - they tried to fix the rattle by shoving a washcloth next to the motor which is a fire hazard. The closet door was off the rail - we got it back on & it still wouldn't budge. Our sink was clogged & leaking. Maintenance sopped up the mess with our towels but didn't offer to replace them nor mop, so the floor was sticky. The bathroom was full of drain flies. There was mildew on the shower curtain & rust on the fixtures. The tile was cracked - it probably dates to the original 1970's hotel. The awning over our
Manager Response: Dear ZambiaJen,  We sincerely apologize for your experience at our hotel. We value guest feedback as it gives us the opportunity to improve the service and facilities that we provide for our guest, and can assure you this is not a typical guest experience. Our staff always takes great pride in providing our guests a clean and safe environment, rest assured we will look into your concerns so that they are addressed. Truly we are grateful you allowed us to be your host during your trip and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary Heading: This review is mostly for two members of the staff: Sabrina the bartender and Leo the lot manager.
Summary: Upon our arrival at the hotel I was greeted by Leo who went above and beyond to answer any questions and make sure we were welcomed. He pointed us in the direction of where we should go, who we should talk to, and also gave us some pointers about things in the area to do (outside of Disneyland). Honestly, this was one of the best experiences I have had pulling into a hotel before. Never have I been received in such a positive manner and treated as the most important person in the hotel, even our departure was the same. Leo is a class act and one that any establishment would value to have on their team as the “face” of the company since he is the first and last person seen when staying at the hotel.  For food we decided to have dinner each night at the bar since they have an
Manager Response: Dear timlovestacos,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled to hear that "Leo" went above and beyond for any assistance you may have had. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments about our hotel and staff and we are overjoyed about Sabrina from our Front Room Lounge being extremely help and courteous. We hope to see you again next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: This is a neat clean hotel located within walking distance to Disneyland and so a good place to stay. Candy at the concierge was extremely helpful and it was much appreciated. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. A further walk but it also has car parking is Joe's Crab Shack and we had a great night there with great food and drinks. This is a decent well located hotel if you are going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Dassan C,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We are thrilled to hear "Candi" was extremely helpful with assisting you with any questions you may have had. We hope to see you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: We stayed at this hotel march 2nd-6th and it was AMAZING! It was me, my 4 yr old son, grandma, sister and her 2 yr old and we upgraded our room and there was plenty of space. Heather at the front desk was exceptional. I called so many times asking questions and she was more than happy take the time to answer. the nob ob our bath tub broke off and they sent a repairman right over and he fixed it up. It was raining so we weren't able to take advantage of the huge pool but it looked wonderful. it is maybe a 10 min walk with kids to the disneyland gates. the only downfall was our neighbor next to us smoked outside his door and our door wasn't sealed all the way so our room smelt like smoke. I will be staying here again and recommend this hotel to everyone!
Manager Response: Dear MamaMalcom,  Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us feedback about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! We are extremely pleased that Heather was able to make your experience a memorable one and we look forward to seeing you again the next time you visit Anaheim!  Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: My wife and I are frequent visitors of the Disney Parks in CA and we stay at many different hotels! This one has by far been one of our favorites.  The proximity to the Main gate is perfect and the rooms were comfortable.  However, when we arrived we asked about upgrading rooms to a king size bed.  We were willing to pay whatever fee there was and wanted to see the availability.  At first we were greeted by an employee who almost seemed robotic in his responses and was obvious that he really didn't care about the guests, which is why i only give 4 stars.  After being told that there was absolutely no possibility of upgrading, we left because we were early for check in.  When we came back there was a different employee at the counter.  His name was Ivan, and he was the nicest
Manager Response: Dear brigstrr,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We are thrilled to hear that "Ivan" was able to accommodate you with an upgrade. We truly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff. We hope to see you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary Heading: "I'll never stay here again" wife said.  I agree.
Summary: This was our fourth hotel on a two week California trip.  Two motels and a Holiday inn.  All were superior.  The advertised size of the room was deceiving.  390 square feet felt like much less because the closet and bathroom area (separated by a small hallway) took up almost a third of the space.  The ceiling also had bulging water damage.  The thermostat looked 20 years old with basic function (warmer/cooler).  No temperature display or reading to set to.  The WiFi was unreliable at best.  Plan on forgetting network and reconnecting with the password every 5 minutes or less.  The speed was up to 8.7mbps when it worked.  Don't plan on using a streaming device.  The internet breaks off too often.  Our room was in the center of the building with full WiFi bars.  We stayed at a $50
Manager Response: Dear ShermanG123,   Thank you for your feedback. We deeply apologize about any challenges you may have experienced during your stay. We will share your feedback with our team to ensure you that your concerns are addressed. We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host during your stay and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: My fiancé and I took a Disneyland vacation to celebrate our engagement and we absolutely enjoyed our stay at The Anaheim Hotel. We booked our trip through Disney Vacations and this will be our official go-to hotel for all of our future Disneyland vacations and Anaheim visits. The hotel is beautiful and very well maintained and everything was ready for us upon arrival. The lobby is welcoming and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We were particularly impressed with the service we received from our Concierge Candi. She has customer service dialed in and truly understands how to make her guests feel not just welcomed, but appreciated and valued. We were so impressed with Candi, the staff and the hotel that we have officially changed our minds on our wedding
Manager Response: Dear forbidden656,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff, especially "Candi" as she is truly a treasure to have with us. We are truly grateful we will be your official go-to hotel! We look forward seeing you next time you visit the resort area! Again, congratulations on the engagement from our whole staff!  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: This place was ok for our last minute trip. It has a hotel lobby but has a motel feel outside.   10 min walk to the front gates of disney which was great. It was surprisingly quiet at night.   We were in room 139 and this room needs some TLC. The front door had basic locks and when closed wasn’t square with the door frame. The sliding door to the balcony looked like it was 50 years old with very basic locks. The room had a smell like the carpet hasn’t been cleaned.
Manager Response: Dear fvalbr21,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We will have our team look into these issues to ensure you that they are addressed. We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host and we hope to see you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: Best place every!  Love the resort and their staff is amazing.  Our room was ready for check-in at 9 am when we arrived.  We checked out late due to inclement weather and they waived our late checkout fee without us requesting that they do so.  Very lose to the Disneyland Resort and a great value for your dollar. Best staff ever! We will definitely be returning guests.
Manager Response: Dear Stay56380870807,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our staff was able to accommodate an early check in. We are pleased that our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our staff as we continue to strive to provide a first class hospitality experience! We look forward to seeing you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: We booked the Anaheim Hotel for a last-minute trip to Disneyland, to save us some time driving down from Los Angeles early in the morning.  In an area flooded with hotels due to its proximity to Disneyland, the Anaheim Hotel was quite a pleasant surprise.  At the price, I was expecting much less than we received.  The staff were great, always friendly, and helpful.  The grounds were clean and well maintained.  The room itself was very big, and had a large, private patio.  As some others have noted, the bathroom was small (especially in comparison to the rest of the space).    The only real negative we encountered was the hot water.  It took a few minutes to get hot enough to shower with, and could (and did) unexpectedly change temperatures a few times during the shower.  But if
Manager Response: Dear SpiderUR05,  Thank you for your feedback. We are thrilled to hear that our staff was friendly and helpful! We apologize about the issues you may have had with the water temperature, rest assured we will have our team look into this issue. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We look forward to seeing you next time you visit the Disney Resort!  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary Heading: First and last time at this hotel.
Summary: This was the first time we have stayed at this property. We are Disneyland season pass holders that make over a dozen trips each year and normally stay at a hotel a few buildings down but chose this place due to its prices.   Check in and parking was really easy. We chose a room on the second floor. It was nice to have a ramp instead of stairwells. The room itself is not that bad but it had a Dirty vibe to it. There was a lot of dust underneath the tv and we found a few long hairs in the shower. The bathroom is really small, even for one person. The biggest complaint we had about this room was the shower and hot water in the sink. It would take nearly 15 minutes to get water hot enough to where you would be comfortable. Once you get the hot water and into the shower, a couple
Manager Response: Dear Corahrb,  Thank you for your feedback. We deeply apologize about the challenges you may have encountered during your stay. We will share your feedback with our team to ensure this issue is addressed. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. Truly we are grateful you allowed us to be your host during your stay and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: Love the hotel, great amenities, friendly and professional staff, great value when coupons or deals are used and super close to the parks and food locations. The rooms are clean and for the most part quiet and more sound proof than others. Pizza Press on the premises is amazing. Overall better than others around!
Manager Response: Dear Voyage20545840624,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our rooms and The Pizza Press. We hope to see you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary: Stayed in the family type sweet with my sisters, cousin, and 4 children. It was ample space and well maintained. Easy walk to the park and family friendly restaurants. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. In particular, Leo was excellent - helping us up to our room with a large number of bags, and being extremely hospitable. I would definitely recommend this for a group traveling to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Elizabeth T,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our hotel and staff, especially Leo as he is truly a great member to have with our team. We hope to see you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management Team

Summary Heading: Thank you to The Anaheim Hotel
Summary: The Anaheim Hotel was AMAZING! This was our firs time staying at the hotel and we cannot recommend it enough.  Upon check in we noticed a friendly face, Steve! We have been visiting Anaheim for 10 years and prior to it being sold/ demolished we would always stay at the Carousel Inn Hotel.
