The location is perfect, it is a quick, nicely landscaped walk to the parks, and super convenient to many food options.  The onsite Pizza Press restaurant serves super fresh options at great prices and is open late. The grounds are large and have lots of green space for kids to run around.  The pool is huge, and you can watch the fireworks during an evening swim!  I have hosted every kind of group and event at this hotel from birthday celebrations and family get-togethers to bachelor and bachelorette parties..  Lots of great
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Love this hidden gem by Disneyland
Summary: Loved this hidden gem by Disneyland. Perfect for a mini stay cation with my husband. Great staff. Pool area was great to watch the fireworks at night. Super close to the park was able to walk there in 5 min!
Manager Response: none

Summary: the best hotel in Anaheim...this hotel made our Disney visit so easy and relaxing..super helpful..walking distance to Disney, staffs are super friendly, our room is clean and tidy. we will definitely go back to this hotel
Manager Response: Dear purplepen116,  Thank you for the wonderful review! We can't wait to welcome you back soon!

Summary: Great location and great value. Short walk to Disneyland.  Restaurants easily walkable.  Walgreens and Cvs are easy to walk to .  Hotel has a great central location. Parking is an extra charge which really should be free.
Manager Response: Dear dewmenice,  Thank you for the wonderful feedback! We are delighted to hear that you found the Anaheim Hotel to be such a great value and so conveniently located. We hope to be your hotel of choice for your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: ...Made everything else worth it. The staff was great and very helpful. I wasn't a fan at all of no microwave. I get it, not in the room because you don't want to clean that many. But there's not even an industrial one on the grounds for people to use. I had incredible egyptian food & vegetarian pho go to waste!
Manager Response: Hello sfoust2018!  Thank you for the feedback! We are delighted to hear you found the hotel to be so conveniently located and the staff so friendly and helpful. For your next visit, please inform the Front Desk you would like a microwave and we would be happy to put one in your guest room as microwaves are available upon request. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back soon!

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disneyland! Location, Location, Location!
Summary: My experience at the Anaheim hotel was very positive. Honestly we weren't at the hotel that much (except to sleep) as it is literally across the street from Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure. When we were in the hotel it was clean, the staff were friendly and the food at the Pizza Press was very tasty. I feel the main selling point is still the proximity to the parks as we were even able to walk back to the hotel for an hours rest after being in the hot sun all day and then go back into the park for the evening. It you are looking for a reasonably priced, solid but not luxury hotel with great access to Disney then this could be the hotel for you.
Manager Response: Dear bennyfilm,  Thank you for the great feedback! We are pleased to hear your experience was so positive and that you found our location to be so perfect for your Disney vacation. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back soon!

Summary: The location and very reasonable price for the proximity to Disney property make this a great hotel. If that’s all you’re looking for, you’re in luck. Based on that alone, I would have given five stars but there were a few aspects that knocked it down to four stars. First, it is a motel with outdoor entrances to rooms, not a hotel with indoor corridors. I prefer the latter and was disappointed to see this. Parking wasn’t great for the $12/night fee, but that falls within the average cost for the area ($10-$20/night). Parking is very limited, so you might not be anywhere near your building. Don’t let the pictures on the website fool you—the only updated areas are the lobby/bar and some of the higher priced suites. Room 436 was still very dated, but fall in what you might expect
Manager Response: none

Summary: If your visiting Disney, this is the perfect hotel. Its 5 minutes’ walk from the front gate, so it means its cheaper than the ‘Disney hotels’, but its so close to the main gate you wouldn’t notice. The hotel itself is very nice, staff are helpful, and facilities onsite are excellent. Has a lovely pool are, towels supplied, and a Pizza restaurant on site, where you make up your own creations. The rooms themselves have a large tv, comfy bed, if a little on the basic side. However we were at Disney all day and not returning till late, so a fancy room would have been wasted on us. If you want a hotel close to Disney and a very reasonable price this is the one. I also had a 5 year old kid with me, and the hotel felt very safe, and most importantly my kid loved it. Next time I visit
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 2 night whilst we explored Disney. The hotel is in a fantastic location situated a 5 minute walk from the entrance. The hotel itself is very nice. Good sized rooms, air conditioning and a nice balcony. We didn’t have time to use the pool but we were impressed with the size and good opening times. Customer service was brilliant - When we arrived in our room, the door handle had fallen off the patio door. We reported this to reception and within 5minutes someone had been and fixed it. A very reasonably priced hotel for such a brilliant location
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spacious room in walking distance to Disney and restaurants.  Cute decor in the lobby. Friendly staff. Parking close to the buildings. This is a motel type hotel, hallways are outside, but covered. Ramp to take luggage up for second floor.  They have rooms with 2 King size beds, great for families. Oversized Vanity with sink and mirror.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel for families or couples. Just minutes away from the theme parks which was a great way to take a break during the day. Very friendly staff & the pool was great. Great value for the accommodations.
Manager Response: Hello wztnu!  Thank you for the wonderful review! We are delighted to hear that you had such an amazing family vacation. We hope to see you next time!

Summary: Great location and perfect place to stay.  Convenient location to the Disney parks.  Very easy walk.  The staff always great us and made sure everything was perfect. Highly recommend this Hotel if you want a place that is very walkable to the parks.
Manager Response: Hello 379judyg,  Thank you for the amazing review! Your recommendation is truly appreciated and we are so happy to hear that everything during your stay was perfect. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: Very nice hotel staff is very attentive.  Best feature is reasonable price and walking distance to Disneyland.  They have a beautiful pool too and pizza restaurant has great food.  This is a great place to stay with family
Manager Response: Hello Q7609VQelenam,  Thank you for the wonderful review! We are delighted to hear that you found our team to be so friendly and attentive and our proximity to the parks so convenient. We hope to welcome you and your family back soon!

Summary: Average hotel - but a great location. One major down point was we asked the hotel to call us a taxi cab to a local attraction. A private taxi cab associated with the hotel arrived and the driver was remarkably rude and demanded money for the whole round trip up front or we would not be picked up and brought back to the hotel later in the day. My advice - don't book a cab through the Anaheim Hotel. Take a short walk up to Disney and catch a yellow cab - its cheaper, fairer and much more pleasant.
Manager Response: Dear Denis T,  Thank you for taking the time to provide a review. While we are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our amazing location within the Anaheim Resort, we are disappointed to hear about your difficulties with transportation. We appreciate your feedback and have shared your experience with the transportation company to ensure quality service for each of our guests.

Summary: Great location 1 block from Disney entrance  but honestly room are old and out dated not the cleanest  def not a 31/2 star hotel maybe 3 more like 21/2 for the room 3 for the lobby and Pool  no elevator near room nobody asked to help with bags as we came in they where to busy polishing the carts  not sure I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello gustavomC5962SR,  Thank you for sharing your experience. While we are disappointed that your stay was less than exceptional, we always value feedback as an opportunity to make improvements. We have recently completed a large scale renovation, however, we are continuously working towards creating the perfect guest experience. We hope to have the opportunity to better accommodate you in the future.

Summary: Stayed for two nights and it was nothing but problems. First night I arrvied there was 0 parking and you have to pay which I think it should be free if your a guest, second off i get checked in and lady at front desk was rude. Shower drain was clogged and water went to my knees when showering, toilet ran all night as well as A/C did not work well nearly at all which is a pretty big deal in july. As well as cobwebbs in the room. I asked if the problems could be fixed numerous times and they sent a technician to my room and he fixed NOTHING!!! No elevators so you have to carry your bags upstairs so it should be called a MOTEL not HOTEL.. I asked for a refund and they laughed and said no sorry.. Instead they Overcharged me! Place should be shut down
Manager Response: none

Summary: The price for what you get is excellent.  The hotel is clean and convenient to the park.  The Hotel staff is friendly and the rooms are large considering many other hotels near Disneyland.  Our biggest complaint is that the beds were not all that comfortable.  Not terrible, just not that great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Best value this close to Disneyland. Rooms are not fancy by any means, but they are clean, and the hotel location is fantastic. Bring your own hairdryer! The pool is massive. The staff have been friendly and helpful during all of my stays. If you're looking for something themed and upscale, this hotel might not be for you, but if you're looking for clean, affordable, and walkable to Disneyland - this place is a winner!
Manager Response: Dear Joann F,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. We are thrilled to hear that you found the Anaheim Hotel to be such a great value! We have over 14 room types of all different sizes and price ranges in hopes of having something for everyone and every budget. We always love hearing from our guests and learning what we can do to make their experience even more enjoyable, so if you have any other feedback for us please do not hesitate to let us know!

Summary: This place is so cute from the outside and very conveniently located to Disneyland (just a short walk across the street). However, the rooms and bathrooms really need an update and their cleaning staff need some training on what it means to actually clean a room. Our room was cleaned at about 4:30 p.m, when we came back for a short break from the park. They didn't clean exchange any of the coffee cups or water glasses and left trash in the bathroom. The lobby staff were friendly. And, the view of the fireworks from our room was amazing.
Manager Response: Dear Rovetti,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are very sorry to hear that you encountered a few housekeeping issues with regards to the daily service of your guest room. We have shared your feedback with our Housekeeping team to ensure these items are properly addressed. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future!

Summary: This hotel was reminiscent of another time. If you like themes, this one is for you. It’s worth the money- close to park entrance, clean and affordable- even the parking is reasonable. Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Randa0368,  Thank you for such a wonderful review! We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our mid century modern aesthetics and found the resort to be clean, affordable, and conveniently located. We look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary Heading: Perfect location, friendly staff, and awesome dining options!
Summary: This will be my go to hotel from now on. The location is as good as it gets for an off Disney property hotel, with the walk being only 10-15 minutes away. My boyfriend and I love the Pizza Press that’s connected to the hotel and ate there nearly everyday, you get a discount with your room key so that’s a plus. The rooms are so nice compared to before they remodeled. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are pleasant overall. Definitely a great experience and will be staying here again for any Disney trip in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Msutton1133,  Thank you for the amazing review! We are so pleased to be your new Anaheim Resort area hotel. Make sure to sign up for our awesome loyalty program to hear about great promotional offers and to start earning towards a free night stay! We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: I love this hotel which used to be Anabella. It is conveniently located in Anaheim, walking distance to Disneyland. Customer service is superb, they were all friendly. I stayed there with my mom and we both enjoyed our stay in the hotel. The room that we booked had the L shaped type which means our beds weren't beside each other so we still had privacy. The food was ok, you get what you pay for. Overall, the hotel was a bit rundown but I would say it was one of the nicest hotels there.
Manager Response: Dear Harvi B,  Thank you for sharing your experience here at The Anaheim Hotel. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed the friendly service of my staff and the room accommodations fit the needs of your family. Please come and visit us again sometime soon!

Summary: Three weeks before my Birthday my Dog Jack passed away , I was a mess and could'nt function , I figured if I couldn't be with my Dog , I'd be with Mickey . I called the hotel directly told them I was an Disney annual passholder and that I had been there twice before explained why I was going and booked a room . Three weeks later when I arrived I was a mess I was spending my birthday alone without my dog , I checked in , went to my room and there next to the bed was a birthday card and fresh soft cookies . Candy the concierge had written the most Beautiful card to welcome me . I came back to the hotel that night and Devon at the front desk smiled and said the biggest hello , You're back ! ( I had been there 9 weeks before )  she saw the birthday button and wished me a happy
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loud and just ok, but convenient
Summary: This hotel is priced appropriately and the service is really friendly and nice.  You are super close to the park and it's easy to walk there and back. The pizza place in house is great. However, the walls and ceiling have zero soundproofing and you feel like your neighbors are actually in your room.  The bed is comfy and the TV is nice and big, but there were only two towels, no bathmat and no bathroom trashcan or towel bar/hooks. The coffee in the room was undrinkable. This was my first time to the area, but my partner tells me that there are better places to stay in the area for similar price.
Manager Response: Dear Amy L,  We appreciate your feedback. We are pleased to hear you found our property to be comfortable, conveniently located, and well priced. Our team is currently looking into the issues addressed however, as all of our guest rooms should be adequately supplied with towels, bathmats, and other amenities. We sincerely apologize that this was not your experience. If willing, we would greatly appreciate the opportunity to welcome you back in the future so that we may better accommodate you and your guests.

Summary: Annual Mother-Daughter adventure first time visiting Disneyland so we stayed at The Anaheim Hotel.  Being from Florida we couldn’t comprehend that the hotel was across the street from Disneyland.  Well, it’s literally a short walk.  The hotel was close to everything we needed, restaurants, Walgreens even rental cars. The hotel offers late checkout, at an additional cost, but so worth it. Our flight didn’t leave until 9 pm and we wanted to relax and shower before we boarded so the late checkout worked for us.  Reasonably priced, friendly staff, close to everything and family friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hey I love the stay I had at the Anaheim hotel we stayed for our family vacation we checked in with Carolina an then Jim came to help with luggage an he blown our minds oh how much he can actually help I just want to say is Jim made this visit 10 times better I hope I see you when I come back thank you so much the rooms are Spacious Double sinks an to basic beds the only problem I have was the ice machine was out in our building our whole stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location right across from Disneyland, and a huge pool by Anaheim standards. Great beds, staff are lovely, and the bar and pizza restaurant are very handy. Would highly recommend for families or adult travellers.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We love this hotel . We stay about 4-5 times a year and always pick this hotel. They are close to the park. An easy walk over, and the ambiance of the decor is terrific! Make sure you say hello to Bobby in the Valet area. He is great!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location is just down the block from Disneyland. You are even able to see the Guardians of the Galaxy ride across the street. A block the other way there are stores.  This was my first time going to Disney and was very impress with the staff and rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Enjoyable stay with in 1/2 block away from the main gates to Disneyland.
Summary: If you are looking for a close place to the main gates of Disneyland that is clean, has a great pool, great Pizza place, and friendly staff and don't mind that the temperature of the shower fluctuates than you found it here.I honestly would stay here again. I didn't think the cost of $12 a day parking was fair but then again, They charge non guests $20 to park. $39 resort fee is just a way to get an extra fee as it isn't a resort. The rooms are typical size and the 4 of us (2 adults and 2 children) were fine in it. Check the A/C filter when you check in, I had to clean the one in our room then it blew nice and cold air. They don't have the special price of $7 pizza anymore but still at $10.25 for any topping pizza is a great deal. Breakfast is costly at $11. They will provide a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Location and Rooms, Horible Service
Summary: The hotel was very nice and located just across the street from Disneyland. They have very good deals, including a very nice veteran’s discount. The room was clean and spacious. The problem was not with the hotel, but with the hotels service. The first thing i want to point out is that I had a reservation for a room with 2 king beds. This reservation was set up almost two months in advance.  When my party arrived to check in, we were informed that even though my grandmother had a service dog for emotional support with tags, they did not accept emotional support dogs as service dogs. They told her this to her face, not very compassionately, and she was obviously disturbed by it. After being told this, we agreed to pay the extremely large pet fee for the hotel so that we had
Manager Response: Dear Noconnor85,  We sincerely apologize for the experience you encountered during your stay and for any miscommunication regarding our pet policy. The hotel does in fact have a pet fee associated with any non service animals in order to ensure all rooms are deep cleaned upon departure to avoid any allergens for future guests. With regards to the billing process, the hotel releases the additional $100 security deposit upon checkout, but it does typically take 3-5 business days to release from your account as it is based upon your banking institution and their policies. We are extremely sorry, however, if our staff was not able to appropriately explain these policies at check in or time of reservation and even more so that you felt a lack of compassion on our behalf. Guest satisfaction truly is our number one priority therefore we highly value all feedback as it is an opportunity for further training and improvement.

Summary: We have stayed here on several occasions while visiting Disneyland. The rooms are spacious and the two king size beds were a plus. The location is very convenient and the air conditioned room was the perfect place to go back and have a mid day nap on a 100 degree day in Disneyland. Not only was the hotel spotless but the service was amazing. The front desk staff were welcoming and very accommodating.   Although the hotel itself and the front desk staff were impeccable, our favorite part of the stay was meeting one of the bellhops that works for a company contracted by the hotel. Leo is one of the most genuine customer service providers I have ever met. He was the first and last person we interacted with during our stay and he made us feel at home from the minute we arrived. Leo
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Blood on the Sheets: My first and last visit to The Anaheim Hotel
Summary: First of all, this place is in a great location within very easy walking distance to Disneyland. It is likely the only thing keeping it in business.  When we first pulled up to the hotel it looked very inviting and pretty "hip" with it's mid century modern style look. The lobby is clean and the initial front desk person was friendly. This is about where my praise for this place ends.  We arrived at the hotel late and just wanted to go to bed before a long day of Disneyland the next day. We were located towards the back of the hotel in the 700 building. There are steps to get up to the second floor, and right after the steps was a giant puddle of what appeared to be water. I thought this was odd and dangerous, but figured it was some kind of anomaly (perhaps someone spilled a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Such a wonderful stay. The staff make you feel very welcomed! The pool is amazing! The walk to Disneyland is nothing, so close! Walking back with 2 little ones at 1am, and I felt safe and secure. We will be returning!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Super close to Disneyland. Nice size pool. Comfortable furnishings.  HINT - you can park here for DL visit even if not staying here $20 a day.  We stayed the next visit nearby & their parking was too expensive after checkout
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Two king beds were a hit
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and chose it for it's proximity to Disneyland.  It was a surprise to see that they offered rooms with two king beds.  As a family with 2 older children, this worked out great to have the extra space. Our room was in a 400 building near the back.  There was no noise except for the occasional excited child running down the corridor outside the room.  Typical vacation area noise and not unexpected.  The room itself was just ok.  Other than the two kings, it was nothing special.  It seemed dated so maybe we didn't get one of the updated rooms that others mentioned.  Walls are also thin and even though we were on the 2nd floor we could hear our neighbors child running around in his room early in the morning.  Bring ear plugs. We only had one issue
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have season passes to Disneyland and stay at this hotel every time I visit. Very clean very friendly staff and across the street from Disneyland. Beds are comfortable and the rooms are spacious. Highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: So close to Disneyland you can smell the fun
Summary: This is a great clean hotel across the road from Disneyland plenty of parking and free wifi a bar and restaurant, large pool and jacuzzi Because most of the rooms are set back from the road this is ideal if you want quiet The staff are very  helpful
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location and great customer service
Summary: The location of hotel to Disneyland was great. Also customer service provided by all, especially Leo was wonderful. He was so friendly and definitely went out of his way to provide great service. The room wasn’t as updated as I expected, the water pressure from shower was not great and AC was loud and hard to set at a comfortable temp.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My new favorite Disney area Hotel
Summary: I have been going to Disneyland with my family annually for the past 13 years. I always stay at one of the Hotels on South Harbor blvd, as this is the most affordable & convenient option to be able walk back & forth into the park. This was the first year we stayed at the Anaheim Hotel & it has become my new favorite in the area. The Hotel is located about 1 & 1/2 blocks away from the entrance, which was very convenient. The grounds are well maintained with a large swimming pool, grass lawns & small gardens throughout. The rooms are located away from the street with privacy & security. The entry lobby is updated with a nice lounge, bar, gift shop & Pizza restaurant next door. The employees were all friendly & helpful. The rooms are in very good condition & the double King sized
Manager Response: none

Summary: I watched this hotel goes through its renovations throughout other trips and decided to stay here this trip as it was done, the Pizza Press being close (my favorite place to eat off Disneyland property) and it's location to the park.  It was also cheaper than my usual hotel, as well as offering a better AP discount than that hotel. It was a good stay.  I arrived early and didn't expect my room to be ready, and they initially said it wasn't.  But offered my a single king sized room that was ready, which was fine as I was alone.  The lobby is very nice, feels very much like a proper hotel rather than a motel.  A staff member greets you whenever you walk by, which is nice.  The grounds are lovely and the vibe from lobby carries on to out there.  My room was the on the second floor
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Upgrade to two King room is same as a rollaway
Summary: 2nd time visitor review/update for May 2018: For my 40th birthday in May I chose to stay at this hotel again for 3 nights. I booked a standard room at a good rate directly with hotel website about a month before my stay.  It was supposed to be just me but last minute I decided to bring my kids. When we arrived I asked if we could either get a rollaway or switch to the standard two king room.  Basically they are the same price so we opted for the two king room.  We were also able to check in a bit early than regular check in time, I think it was 2pm.  We were at the other end of the building I stayed in on my 1st visit. No balance which is fine. This particular room the ac unit was built into the room with a thermostat on the wall and the air vent on the wall too. The ac worked
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location and time for  another trip here again in August it is the best place to stay we love it here everyone treat's you well and courtesy, kind helpful and always there for you if you need help
Manager Response: Hello fastbev648!  Thank you for the wonderful review! We look forward to welcoming you back in August! Please let us know if you need any assistance with booking a reservation.   Regards,  Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Bait and Switch hotel, living off location, not the hotel itself
Summary: I don't expect my hotel rooms to look picture perfect like the pictures online, but I at least expect them to be in the same ball park, well not with The Anaheim Hotel. This was a classic bait and switch. First off the rooms look nothing like the picture, the pictures were staged and the actual rooms are at least 10 years older, not that nice or updated. For the price you are paying at that hotel you could stay at a Marriott or Hilton or any name brand hotel. If this hotel was located anywhere else in the world there is no way they could charge what they charge. In simple terms it was Super 8 quality with HIlton prices. It started bad and went down hill from there...  We walk in after a long day of flights and driving and get surprised by 12 dollar a day parking fee, ok, fine,
Manager Response: Good Afternoon Nico7291997,  We are very sorry to hear that your stay was less than satisfactory and that a member of our team was not able to correct the concerns you brought to our attention. We always appreciate hearing from our guests as it allows us the opportunity to learn and improve. While all of our guest rooms have been renovated within the last year, we are continuing various projects to increase the overall guest experience, therefore your feedback is very valuable.  We sincerely apologize, however, if the parking and $3 resort fee were not properly explained prior to your arrival. We pride ourselves on being more than just hotel. In fact, our resort feel with the beautiful landscape, outdoor common areas, guest room patios, and olympic size pool are just some of the many features that make us so unique within the Anaheim Resort area.   We would like to try and correct your experience and ensure the issues you mentioned are adequately addressed, therefore we have reached out personally to learn more about your reservation. Thank you again for taking the time to share with us your experience and we hope to have the opportunity to speak with you further.   Sincere Regards,  Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: Just stayed for 2 days at this hotel for my sons Graduation trip. First room we were put in had ripped carpet and an unworking AC. We called the front desk and were taken to a second room which had a broken tv and also an unworking AC. Before we were taken to a third room we had to agree to downsize from 2 king beds to 2 queen beds. We were frustrated and tired so we agreed. The third room had a decent AC but had these strange black flies flying around our room, also the shower handle was loose/broken. There were also weird stains on the headboard. The location to Disney is good and the staff was pretty friendly. But I don’t think we will be here again. 😪
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Anaheim hotel was an amazing place to stay. Staff was so friendly, rooms were clean, a very nice vibe. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a decently priced room with a very short walk to the Disneyland resorts!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: After checking in we were helped to our room by a valet named Leo. He was very friendly and helpful and made sure we enjoyed our stay. The location is perfect, almost across the street from Disneyland main entrance. Our room was clean and it was nice to see real ceramic coffee mugs instead of the paper ones I get at most places. WiFi was included in our stay. The tub drain plugged up while we were there, but they had it fixed quickly. Our room was a double queen and a little smaller than I anticipated, but since we were spending most of our time at Disneyland it didn't matter. The view of the fireworks from the balcony was great. We'll definitely be staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here with my two boys ages 14 and 11 for three nights in April. I was looking for a place that wouldn’t break the bank, within walking distance to Disney and had at least one king bed or a combination of beds for all of us.   The lobby and grounds were beautiful as was the enormous swimming pool and hot tub. We made use of the pool every afternoon and absolutely loved it.   The room, albeit not updated, fit exactly what I was looking for.  It had two king beds, a LARGE vanity area and was clean. The room showed its age but was perfectly acceptable especially for the time we were in it...which really was just to sleep.   Pros: The pool Room size Close to Disney  Beautiful grounds and lobby Coffee in room Refrigerator in room Economical   Cons: Housekeeping was excellent
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is very near disneyland! Just walking distance.. very convenient for family of five like ours. Big spacious room. After a very tiring day, we just ate yummy pizza at pizza press which is just beside the hotel. Disney tickets readily available at the front desk. No need to buy tickets at disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just stayed at the Anaheim hotel near Disneyland and had a wonderful experience! The room was very clean and spacious.  And the staff made us feel welcome, they were helpful and friendly.  It is located a short distance from the park which is a huge plus!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been staying here for years and love every minute of it. The staff is so friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and huge. The pool is amazing. The pizza press connected and the bar are great spots too! The value is incomparable!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: Hotel location was flipping amazing literally across the street from Disneyland, 2 blocks from 2 pharmacies, Starbucks, Blaze pizza and many other amenities. Also, if you aren't staying here you can park in their lot for $20 and walk across the street to Disneyland (way better than taking the bus or tram from the Disney parking structures).  Pool was large, plenty of seating and privately enclosed. Food ans drinks in the lobby were great! Service was quick.  Our room had a large vanity with double sinks and a separate bathroom perfect for 4 friends sharing a room.  Room was large!   Cons: The rooms were dark and wifi doesn't reach the last few rooms furthest from the lobby had to go outside in the hall to get service. Our room felt dirty (mostly the carpet) even thought it
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: What a wonderful hotel at a great rate!
Summary: Wonderful hotel at a very reasonable rate  that’s just a short walk to Disneyland.  Rooms were spacious enough for my family of five to not be completely on top of each other. Loved the big pool and jacuzzi and the breakfast at the restaurant was delicious and affordable. But the best thing about this hotel, hands down, is Candy at the Front Desk. She went above and beyond to assist us with an delivery of medical supplies for our son. Even called us after we got home to make sure everything worked out. She made our stay exceptional, and though she definitely stood out, the customer service overall was some of the most personal I’ve seen in a long time.  We will definitely return to this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had two rooms. One was ok the other not. Cobwebs, an air conditioner that was useless with a bed pushed up against it. Made for a miserable first night trying to rearrange the beds to get air flowing since all maintenance felt was necessary was to tape the curtain against the window. ??   Random stains on the carpet and chair. Rooms smelled what we felt resembled that of a recycling center.  We addressed our concerns with the one room and were told they would call the next day with our options. We had not received a call by toddler nap time. While napping got a call about changing rooms and a few minutes later someone entering our room without permission and with our privacy hanger on the door. The gentleman was advised by the front desk to move our belongings though front
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel with even better staff
Summary: Had an awesome stay at the Anaheim hotel this past May. They recently renovated the property and while it’s still like a 3 star property, it has a much nicer feel overall. There’s still the odd shortcoming here and there, but you cannot beat the amazing breakfast (and lunch/dinner) at Pizza Press, and location to Disney. The rooms are nice, beds comfortable, full of amenities like a safe, fridge, and microwave. The gym on site is OK. Pool is beautiful. All in all no complaints, awesome property. The staff is what truly makes this place a gem. Bobby outside is SUCH a huge help with anything you need. He gave us a hand on several occasions and was always ‘like a friend’ chatting with us each morning. Huge thank you to him. The front desk staff were great as well, they handled
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked this hotel after our airbnb had major issues. We were so glad we did. The hotel is located just a 5 minute walk from Disneyland, and a few minutes from Bubba Gumps, The Cheescake factory etc. Attached to the hotel is the pizza press which is a cheap but great little pizza restaurant. All the staff were brilliant, hotel very clean, rooms comfortable. It has a really nice pool which we didn’t use due to poor weather. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My new husband and I loved this place! We reserved this last minute and when we arrived the room was neat and clean and the cleaning ladies were very sweet and attentive! Its about 5 minutes away from Disney itself and about 20 minutes (without traffic) to LA. The rooms were always cool, the showers were clean and we enjoyed sitting on the balcony after a long night in LA and just eating a pizza and enjoying the warm air! Overall this was a great location at a great price! We will definitely be returning to this place on our next trip to Anaheim/LA
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently stayed at The Anaheim Hotel for 4 nights. 2 adults and our 8 year old son. Very pleased with its location, a very easy quick walk to the main gates of Disneyland. The main areas, lobby, huge pool, restaurant and bar areas are all great and have undergone a refurb. I expect the next stage for refurb might be the rooms, which are needing some money spent on them. While the rooms are adequate and comfortable the bathrooms are showing their age, but are very clean. The towels need replacing. Our first night was spent in room 735. It was dreadfully noisy. A constant loud noise, possibly from an industrial air con unit made it very difficult to sleep. We mentioned this to Carlos at reception the next day,he was very helpful and offered us another room 411 which was quiet. I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Location - Quiet Room - Great Lounge and Decor
Summary: When booking a hotel near Disneyland it's a fine balancing act for us between price and location/proximity to the parks.  We like to walk but not more than a half mile if we can help it and hate shuttles and rental cars. The Anaheim Hotel fit the bill on this most recent trip.  The price was not much higher than where we've stayed the last 2 trip yet was about 10-15 minutes closer to the parks which is a big deal after walking around for 12 or so hours.  Also very close to Garden Walk and the House Of Blues. There were only 2 negatives: the floor tile grout in our bathroom was crumbling and a tile or two was loose, and the shower head diverter was near impossible to pull up in order to get water up to the shower head.  Now the pluses:  Room was a good size (a standard double
Manager Response: none

Summary: Videoed to my husband while he was talking with staff about eating venues. Staff was able to view roaches in room. Once we got our stuff out and went to check out manager and new front desk staff said they heard about roach however that staff member had wenr home,for the day.Really not 10mins later- how convenient. They did not even want to give a refund and we have only been there 45 mins; with 1st 30 at the pool.Checked into LaQuinta; more spacious and no bugs. A saved family vacation, no thanks to the Anehiem Hotel. Two thumbs down!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is offering many discounts available including Disney annual pass making for a great value on a hotel that is withiin easy walking distance of the Anaheim Parks. Still undergoing what has turned into massive removations of an older property with some very unique landscaping. very nice sized rooms with patio or balcony. Great deal! The pizza prss restaurant is nothing short of incredible (especially for the price). Very professional staff!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I decided to stay at this hotel on a recommendation from a friend because they said it was updated and close to disneyland. I was pretty disappointed when I got to the room. Stains on the ceiling, furniture is really outdated, floors need replacing, bed was not comfortable and looked old. The size of the room and bathroom are big but the lack of furniture makes it feel empty and incomplete. The lobby looks nice, clean & modern which is what the rooms should also look like. I decided on the second day of my stay to relook at the website because I knew I wouldn’t book a hotel that looked like the room I stayed in. The photos were nothing like the room I had - not the same furniture, or bedding, ect - and then I realized that I got an old room. So i paid and booked this hotel based
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed here for our annual Disney resort vacation this year and we had an overall great experience at this hotel. To start, we arrived early on our check in day and I was not expecting to be able to check-in to the room(and that would have been ok, considering that it was about 10:15 A.M. when we arrived) , but the front desk associate informed us that our room was in fact ready and we were able to check in to the room right away. This was a big plus for us because we didn't have to worry about leaving our bags in our vehicle while we headed over to the park. Upon entering the room, we were pleasantly surprised by the renovations that have been made to this hotel. The bathroom, furniture, fixtures, bedding and carpet were all upgraded. The vanity area had double
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Business and Family Trips
Summary: I've stayed here twice now, once on business and once on vacation with my kids and I was very satisfied! The Kids and I loved the pool and hot tub and we had custom pizza everyday.  The staff was very accomodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the end of April, valet was kind and helpful when we arrived. The walk is great along with the Pizza restaurant they have attached to the hotel. We were having a few issues in our room with the AC and the noise from possibly are neighbors. We spoke with Robert who assisted us with finding us a new room when we brought these issues to his attention. He personally came to our room with valet to walk us over and assist with luggage along the way. He went above and beyond in finding us a better room for the duration of our stay. We will be returning due to him and the wonderful valet staff they have
Manager Response: none

Summary: Exceptional customer service on arrival, we asked for interconnecting rooms for our 2 groups, Sam Anguiano went out of his way to meet our request, which we were very thankful for.  All staff acknowledged us upon entry and exit with a friendly smile.  Close to lots of eating places ie Cheesecake Factory   Great little bar, thanks Joseph for your friendly service.  Easy walking distance to Disneyland.  Overall a great place to stay. Highly Recommended.
Manager Response: Greetings JnJ1234,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel!  We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip! Be sure to contact us directly so we can offer the best rates possible as well as introduce you to our complimentary Frequent Stay Program with newly updated perks and bonuses!  Best Regards.  The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: The location to the park was the biggest plus and the pizza place adjacent to the hotel. The pool area, grounds and lobby were good. The room was nothing special. Our closet door barely opened, the floor was so squeaky, the toliet had flush problems and the bath water took a long time to drain. Beds were ok and decor was basic. Overall an average hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, not far from Disneyland
Summary: When I arrived at check-in time, my room wasn't ready until about 40 minutes after so I had to wait. They upgraded my room at no charge, which was a nice gesture. The employee who helped me check in was a bit rude. The room wasn't as clean as I liked it to be. The shower was stained, didn't look like it had been scrubbed clean. The sink faucet and its handles had toothpaste stains covering them. Overall, for the price and location it's a good hotel. However I will not be staying again due to the cleanliness issue.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our room was nice enough, it wasn't overly plush.  We were on a second floor of one of the buildings in the 400s, it was nice enough.  When we checked in there were some mystery hairs in the bathtub that was a little gross.  Room service was always super late in the day and tended to take awhile.  Our check-in wasn't the best, because the guy checking us in had some what of an attitude because of how we booked with two reservations, even though we had called months ahead of time to book.  The room was nice enough, but the mattress was pretty rough, but for the closeness to Disneyland, it was really nice, and the pizza place in the hotel was great.
Manager Response: Greetings elisabeth b,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! I sincerely apologize for the challenges you encountered during your visit with us, our staff strives to provide to best service possible. We greatly appreciate your feedback and will have these concerns regarding your staff experience handled so that it does not repeat. We are grateful you allowed us to be your host during your trip and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Best Regards,  The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: “A great spot for a Disney Trip - worth the money for the location and facilities”
Summary: Pros; - Two very large beds with great quality clean linen  - Good selection of TV channels  - Fridge in room  - Hawaiian tropic soap, shampoo and conditioner  - Amazingly close to Disney / Downtown Disney  - Great pool  - Friendly staff  - In-room info has coupons for takeaway meal deals  - IHOP, Dennys and Walgreens all within walking distance  - Good WiFi   Cons; - Additional charge for parking  - Soundproofing could be better
Manager Response: Dear Fiatwrecker,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear you enjoyed our hotels close proximity to the gates of Disneyland. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding The Anaheim Hotel and our staff. We are truly grateful to be your host during your trip and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: Clean. Friendly staff and very military friendly! I mentioned my husnand’s 21st anniversary with the army being The Weeknd we stayed and the conscierge upgraded us to a room with a balcony overlooking the back of the Disney parks! There were also these AMAZING chocolate chip cookies left in the room with a note from the staff thanking him for his service!  Very convenient to familiar restaurants like IHOP and Denny’s as well as a couple blocks to the Disney parks! I posted a glowing review on social media while we were there and already have a friend who is strongly considering staying there next year with her family.
Manager Response: Dear Enid,  Thank you for your feedback. We greatly appreciate all the kind comments regarding our staff as well always strive to provide a first class hospitality experience. Great to hear our hotels close proximity fit your travel needs to the parks and restaurants around the area! We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host during your trip and hope to accommodate you and your friends in the future!  Kind Regards, Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: The rooms here are nice. There is a refrigerator and coffee maker in the rooms. Great for families with kids. The Olympic size swimming pool is awesome. The staff here is always friendly. Good drinks and food at the bar. If you have a problem in the room, let the staff know and they will take care of it.
Manager Response: Dear Trigali,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear you enjoyed our rooms with the amenities inside. Its always a pleasure to hear our staff was friendly and courteous! We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host during your visit and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Anaheim Resort area.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: We came with a group of 155 teens for a Disney trip.  Getting the correct room assignments for that many teens is nearly impossible but the staff were kind, gracious and patient and all our teens were happy.  Stephen was wonderful to work with and would book here again for the next trip!
Manager Response: Dear Kelley B,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel. It was our pleasure to host your group! We are extremely pleased our staff was able to provide the level of service that allowed everyone to enjoy their visit and we look forward to seeing you again on your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Very good hotel for Disneyland park visitors
Summary: I booked this hotel based on online reviews and it's distance to the Disneyland Park. We arrived during the wee hours but the staff was still very accommodating and courteous. The room we booked had two queen beds on the back building, and the hotel did not disappoint.   Pros: * Hotel proximity to Disneyland. It was a quick 5-10minute walk from the hotel to the park * Rooms were semi-modern and well-maintained.  * The hotel had very spacious parking lots.  Cons: * The back building only had ramps vs elevators. I think this makes sense since it was only a two storey building, but with us traveling with two toddlers on strollers and luggages, the elevator would have been a convenience.  Overall, I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel to tourists/families/couples looking for an
Manager Response: Dear Popcorn_Daddy,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! We are excited to hear that our property met your expectations! We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed this visit and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Clean Rooms. Spacious Rooms. Nice Pool. Close to Disneyland . Friendly staff
Summary: Clean Rooms. Comfortable beds. Spacious. Nice heated shower. Good pressure. Nice Pool. Television is nice. Refrigerator is good. Nice little backyard. Friendly Staff. Easy parking. Clean Lobby. Easy access to vending machines.
Manager Response: Dear Mike N,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! We are truly excited that our property and staff met or exceeded all of the aspects you looked for. We are extremely pleased your party enjoyed your visit and we hope you consider us for your next Disney trip!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: Great location, great staff perfect for a Disney getaway.  Made return reservations with front desk, have asked 5 times for that reservation to be email, I have yet to receive it.  Not sure why?  Probably best to cancel and just re book myself..If you want to be a part of their frequent stayer program, you must book directly with them.
Manager Response: Dear Cindy M,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent visit to The Anaheim Hotel! I apologize for any challenges regarding your confirmation email, we will review the system to ensure everything is in working order so this does not occur in the future. We are extremely pleased you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you again soon!   Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Not the best hotel, but if you want to save money, you can stay here. They have an okay sized pool & hot tub, but chairs are VERY limited. The rooms are not really up to date in my opinion. After the maid services visited our room, several things appeared to be gone or missing. I believe they have 1-2 restaurants on sight, but I did not eat at any of them. The location is not bad though, it's only a short walk to restaurants, CVS, Disney, etc. No breakfast was included.
Manager Response: Dear Kennedy B,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! I sincerely apologize for the challenges you encountered during your visit with us. We greatly appreciate your feedback and will have these concerns regarding the pool chairs and housekeeping service brought to the appropriate departments for review. We are grateful you allowed us to be your host during your trip and hope you will consider us next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: Just checked out of our hotel of 3days & 2 nights & we couldn’t be more satisfied!   Candi took great care of us & had amazing customer service ! We will be back again for our next vacation!   -The Todorvitch Family
Manager Response: Dear Chris T,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Anaheim Hotel! We are extremely pleased that Candi was able to make your experience memorable and that your party enjoyed your visit! We look forward to seeing you during your next trip to the Disney Resort!  Best Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: When we booked our room we forgot to request a downstairs because the hotel doesn't have an elevator. After spending some time at Disneyland we went back to the hotel to take a break. We walked to the park and back and then had to walk up the stairs to our room. It was to much for my sister she has a bad back and knee so we asked the desk if we could switch to a downstairs room. They were so accommodating and got us a room downstairs. We are so grateful because after walking to the park and walking around and walking back we where so worn out. We decided to sit in the spa and relax a bit that was nice. The pool is huge. The grounds of the hotel our beautifully landscaped and clean. I really love this place. The room was nice and spacious. Downstairs has a huge patio with a table
Manager Response: Dear Christal,  Thank you for your feedback. Great to hear our staff was accommodating to your needs of wanting a first floor room. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed our Olympic size pool and the landscape our property has to offer. We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host during your trip and hope to see you next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Won the nicest place to stay  Around Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed there about 5 times over the past year and half I  have found it to be an absolutely amazing place to Stay  Lana was absolutely amazing. You can book through other websites but I have found it much easier to call the hotel direct you seem to get a better price in which you will get online. The housekeeping staff is on top of it they're there if you need anything they are quick the rooms are very clean. Did run into an issue  During check in but after about an hour it was resolved. The security staff there is absolutely polite and very helpful Audrey offer to help us with our bags since my wife was disable great staff great service just one issue that we had in again that was resolved we will definitely be staying there again for our travels.
Manager Response: Dear Chris M,  Thank you for your feedback. It’s always a pleasure to hear feedback from our returning guest. Lana is truly a treasure to have with us hear at The Anaheim Hotel and we are glad she was amazing and helpful. We are truly grateful you allowed us to be your host during your trip and look forward to seeing you again next time you visit the Disney Resort.  Kind Regards, The Anaheim Hotel Management

Summary: My family of 3 stayed here for 3 nights mid week and received the 25% off deal. We were in the 500 building close to the pool. I don't think this building has been renovated as the other buildings have. We had a tiny room with 2 Doubles (I reserved a larger room with 2 Queens, but didn't complain as we got an early check in).  If our room had been cleaned this rating would go to a 4 out of 5. I am totally fine with an older non renovated room and building, but its frustrating that they didn't even clean it. Its someone's job and it wasn't done.  The rooms are motel style, with the doors opening to the outdoors. I was also told by the front desk that the 2 KING rooms do not come with a balcony or patio.   PROS: Granted an early check in (2pm)  Easy check out Nice foyer renovation
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location is great, it is such a short walk to the park, and food options near by. I would say it took about 10 min to walk to the gates of the Disneyland park each day. The room itself was pretty clean,  but the bathroom could have used some cleaning. We had some problems with the water like other guest but it didn’t seem as bad at night. Check in and check out was easy, no issues with charges to my card or parking. It wasn’t the best hotel I have stayed in, but for the price and location it was okay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We’ve stayed at the Anaheim Hotel twice in the last three months because they’ve had great rates. The lobby and guest services are wonderful. It is nice to have the yummy Pizza Press and bar on site. The pool and workout room are nice and seem to be well taken care of. The $12 parking is super reasonable for the area.  The room for our first stay was completely different than our first. We had two double beds and a patio. It was an old room and was missing pictures from the wall. Very outdated compared to the rest of the hotel. Our second room was much nicer. It was a huge room that had been recently painted and the bathroom looked redone. Overall, for the price and location the Anaheim Hotel is a good value. We would definitely consider staying again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love the renovations and theme of retro 1950s mid century. Love the change of the restaurant to The Pizza Press (although it is quite busy). Beds appear to have been changed and are really comfortable. Laundry available on site, but there is no seating in the room for people wanting to stay while laundry is done. Computers in Business Centre are slow; took 30 minutes to check in for flight. Proximity to Disneyland is great, 10-15 minutes walk. Staff are friendly. Would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Value for a Disney Trip
Summary: We stayed here for one night on a Travelzoo special for $99.00. A quick one night trip to Disneyland. Within walking distance to the parks. On first arrival the lobby has been renovated and has a cool retro look with many seating areas and a small lounge/bar area. Check in was quick, but did not like the table with people  trying to get us to get free stuff as we walked out of the lobby to our room, they accosted us every time we walked by, hotel should deep six this. There is a very large gift shop in the lobby with lots of souvenirs and snacks. Outside the pool is huge and the grounds are very nice. The rooms are organized in several separate two story buildings with ramps to the second floor. Very much a throw back to an earlier era. The rooms have been renovated to a certain
Manager Response: none

Summary: Would have been a 5but we had problems getting into our room every night. Took 3 to 4 tries to get the key to work. Even had the valet try to get in and he had trouble. We had three room keyes and had trouble with all of them. Same problem would happen even after we had them rekeyed. We will continue to stay here as I believe that this was just a fluke as we never had this problem before.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location and room. Staff is very friendly. Walls are thin and you can hear upstairs steps and noise if in lower level room. Bar closes very early. Property grounds are nicely kept. Rooms are dingy and walls are dirty especially for being recently remodeled.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Performing Arts HS Trip - Valets are outstanding!
Summary: We traveled here with 153 high school students.  The rooms were amazing and the beds were very comfortable.  The hotel is a quick walk to Disney.  The cabana room was a great meeting place for our large group.  The trip was great!  Unfortunately, I hurt my knee while on duty in the lobby.  I could not walk on it.  Leo, the valet, was the only staff member who noticed and found a wheelchair for me and helped me to my room.  He also helped me get into transportation to a nearby hospital.  He was amazing!  When I returned from the hospital, Audrey pushed me to my room and got me ice in a pillow case, extra ice, and other items to help.  She also ordered a scooter for me.  The next day Caesar brought me the scooter and also checked to see how I was doing.  The valets went above and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not only did I arrive early before check in time  but I was also a dollar short ($99.00) for my deposit fee ($100).   Instead of Making me run through hoops to deposit a dollar in my account , she went ahead and waived the dollar to allow my deposit to be only $99. Kendall made sure she did the check in process as speedy and efficiently as she possibly could with nothing less than a smile on her face the whole time.   I travel often and this was my first time visiting this property and Kendall’s help and service made sure it won’t be last !
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was decent but the renovation of the rooms was done cheaply compared to the facade and lobby. Parking is now an added expense. The pizza place looks nice but not sure there is a breakfast option for the morning. Overall, the price is comparable to the newer nicer hotels but the walk to the park makes it a good option. Rooms are easy to access (motel really). Unfortunate that the renovation caused them to eliminate the free parking and cheap breakfast buffet. It would be OK if the rooms weren't so cheaply redone.

When we left the let us store our luggage, we were able to enjoy the day at the park, and then come get our stuff when it was time for us to leave to the airport for our flight. Summary Heading: Not bad for famlies on a budget
Summary: This is an old resort that they have attempted to make "trendy 60s"  The good:  5 minute walk to Disney entrance and very large pool and hot tub.  Nice reasonably priced resturaunt that serves traditional american breakfast in the morning and good pizza at night. Room beds were comfortable.  The bad:  No balcony on second floor units.  No elevator to second floor.  Rooms are a bit  musty and the fit and finish is very lacking with  cracked tiles in bathroom and bad paint job.  This sort of goes for the whole place.  The ugly:  There really is none.  This is a get what you pay for kinda place that is fine for someone with average expectations.

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled by the remodeled lobby!
Summary: The lobby had a nice mid-century modern look.  The rooms, however, were old and musty smelling.  My room had stained chairs - definitely didn't sit on those!  The bathroom had drain flies.  My room was at the very end of the property next to the parking and the door frame was cracked with NO guard bar on the door!  I asked to be moved but was told there were no available rooms.  My associates rooms were also musty and old but at least the doors were more secure.  I was never happier to check out of a hotel!  Close to the convention center and across from Disney but not worth it.  Think twice.
